info.hearthstones.screen.empty: You haven't visited any Tavern yet. Try build new one!
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.1: §6§lSHIFT+Right click§r to see list of Waypoints
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.3: §6§lUse on Tavern§r to create a new Waypoint
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.4: §6§lUse on Lectern§r to put Binder on
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.5: §6§lCraft with Waypoints§r to add the Waypoint to Binder
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.7: §6§lRight click with Waypoint§r to add the Waypoint
info.hearthstones.screen.binder.help.8: §6§lRight click with Binder§r to copy each other's data to another
info.hearthstones.screen.help.select: §6§lLeft click§r to select this Tavern as destination
info.hearthstones.screen.help.remove: §6§lRight click§r to remove this Tavern from List (Cannot be undone!)
info.hearthstones.screen.property.home: This Tavern is set to Home Tavern
info.hearthstones.screen.property.global: You didn't visit this Tavern, but still can use this Tavern thanks to the power of Global Tavern!
info.hearthstones.screen.property.shabby: This Tavern can be accessed only with Hearthing Planks
info.hearthstones.screen.property.too_fa: The Gem might break if you go to this Tavern...
§aPlayers can use this Tavern even if the player haven't visited the Tavern yet.§r
§7Can be crafted by using Blue Taverncloth on Tavern Block.§r
info.hearthstones.hearthstone.confirm_de: Are you sure you want to remove this Tavern from list? §lThis cannot be undone!
info.hearthstones.hearthstone.cooldown: §cYou have to wait to use Hearthstone again.§r
info.hearthstones.hearthing_planks.help: Home Tavern is not have been set.
info.hearthstones.hearthing_planks.no_ho: §cHome Tavern is not have been set.§r
info.hearthstones.hearthing_planks.toolt: §8§oSmall. Lightweight. Durable. Works perfectly. Definitely for long-time use. Most importantly, can be used to travel to Tavern other than home.§r
info.hearthstones.hearthing_gem.tooltip: §cHas longer cooldown than Hearthstone. Will not withstand long-ranged, or interdimension travel.§r
§bWarps with currently riding animal/vehicle, nearby tamed/leashed animals, and nearby players with Companion Stone in their hand.§r
info.hearthstones.companion_stone.toolti: §bAllows to warp with other players using Companion's Hearthstone.§r
info.hearthstones.taverncloth.tooltip.ea: §eUpgrades Shabby Tavern to Normal Tavern. But what is Shabby Tavern? I don't know.§r
info.hearthstones.tattered_taverncloth.t: §8§oDowngrades Taverns into Shabby Tavern... If you want to.§r
info.hearthstones.waypoint.tooltip.0: §eStores the name and position of a Tavern. Can be given to other players.
info.hearthstones.waypoint.tooltip.1: §eRight click at a Tavern to store its data. Use it again to retrieve the data.
info.hearthstones.binder.no_waypoint: There's no waypoints left in Waypoint Binder.
info.hearthstones.binder.overlay.help.1: §6§lSHIFT+Right click§r to see list of Waypoints
info.hearthstones.access.public: §aPublic Tavern§r grants both §aaccess and modification§r of the Tavern to §aeveryone§r even if they are not the owner of the Tavern. But they can't make Tavern not public, of course.
info.hearthstones.access.protected: §6Protected Tavern§r §6allows everyone to use§r the Tavern. However the property can be §6changed only by the owner, or player with OP permission§r.
info.hearthstones.access.team: §bTeam Tavern§r can be used by §byou and your team members, and player with OP permission§r.
info.hearthstones.access.private: §cPrivate Tavern§r can be used only by §cyou and player with OP permission§r.
command.tavern_memory.add.unloaded: Position %s is outside of loaded area.
command.tavern_memory.add.out_of_world: Position %s is outside of world boundary.
command.tavern_memory.add.not_global: Tavern at %s is not Global Tavern.
command.tavern_memory.add.success.global: Added Tavern memory %s to Global Tavern Memory.
command.tavern_memory.remove.success.glo: Removed Tavern memory %s from Global Tavern Memory.
command.tavern_memory.remove.no_memory: Tavern memory with Tavern at %s doesn't exist.
